title: Professional CV Builder with Login, Photo, and Instant CV Generation

requirements.text: Add authentication using Internet Identity and create a dedicated Login page that lets users sign in and sign out.

quotes: Add nesessery section and login page..

acceptanceCriteria: A Login page exists with a clear sign-in and sign-out flow using Internet Identity.
When signed out, the user is prompted to sign in before accessing the CV builder.
When signed in, the UI shows the authenticated state (e.g., user indicator + sign-out).

requirements.text: Persist each user’s CV data in the Motoko backend keyed by the authenticated user principal, with APIs to create/update, fetch, and clear/reset the saved CV.

quotes: Make website of making cv with proper details and photo.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to save CV data for the caller, fetch the caller’s saved CV data, and clear/reset the caller’s CV data.
Data is isolated per user principal (one user cannot read/overwrite another user’s CV).
If a user has no saved CV yet, the fetch method returns an empty/default state without errors.

requirements.text: Create a CV Builder page with a structured form that collects professional CV details across necessary sections, including at minimum: Personal Details, Professional Summary, Work Experience, Education, Skills, Projects, and Certifications/Awards (as optional).
acceptanceCriteria: The CV Builder form includes distinct sections with appropriate fields and supports multiple entries where relevant (e.g., multiple jobs, multiple education items, multiple projects).
Form validation prevents obviously incomplete core data (at minimum: name + at least one contact method).
All user-facing labels, helper text, and placeholders are in English.

requirements.text: Implement a photo upload feature in the CV Builder that allows the user to add a profile photo and include it in the generated CV output.

quotes: Make website of making cv with proper details and photo.

acceptanceCriteria: User can upload an image file (common formats such as PNG/JPG) and see a preview in the builder.
The uploaded photo is saved with the user’s CV data and is restored on reload after fetching saved CV data.
The generated CV view displays the photo in a professional placement (e.g., header/side column) without breaking layout.

requirements.text: Provide an instant CV generation experience: as the user fills the form, show a professional CV preview template that updates immediately, and provide a way to export/print the CV from the browser.

quotes: instant cv maker ..cv should be profesional.

acceptanceCriteria: A CV preview is available and reflects current form values without requiring a manual ‘generate’ step.
The CV uses a clean, professional layout with consistent typography and spacing.
A clear action exists to export/print (e.g., ‘Print / Save as PDF’) that produces a print-friendly output.

requirements.text: Add a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) that feels professional and is applied consistently across Login, Builder, and Preview screens (avoid a blue/purple default palette).
acceptanceCriteria: The app uses a consistent, professional visual style across all pages.
The chosen palette is not primarily blue/purple unless explicitly required by the user (not required here).
Layout is responsive and usable on both mobile and desktop.

constraints: Use only the platform-supported stack: Motoko single-actor backend and React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query frontend.

Do not edit frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose these components instead).
No external databases or third-party authentication providers; Internet Identity only.
nonGoals: Multi-user collaboration on the same CV document.
External cloud storage for uploaded photos or CV files.
Integration with third-party resume templates/marketplaces or external job boards.
